sub_topic: Determination of molecular geometry and bond angles.
message_1: What is the molecular geometry and bond angle of the carbon dioxide molecule (CO2) according to VSEPR theory?
message_2: According to the VSEPR (Valence Shell Electron Pair Repulsion) theory, the molecular geometry of the carbon dioxide molecule (CO2) is linear. The bond angle between the carbon-oxygen bonds is 180 degrees.
